data.title: Picnic Pickle
data.solution:
import math

firstweekday = int(input())
totaldays = int(input())
n = int(input())
weekdays = [int(input().split()[1]) for _ in range(n)]

def num_weekdays(weekday):
    diff = weekday - firstweekday
    if diff < 0: diff += 7 
    return math.ceil((totaldays-diff) / 7)
   
print(totaldays - sum(map(num_weekdays, weekdays)))
data.statement:
Garfield's family is very peculiar. Each one of his cat brothers and sisters hates a particular day of the week. They don't want to do anything at all at that day, not even meet up with their family.

[[n]] brothers and sisters want to go to a picnic together, they decided to go between some start date and some end date. Your job is to find how many <<opportunities>> (How many days <<none>> of them hate) they'll have during that time period. You're given the weekday of start date and the total amount of days during that time period.

data.constraints:
0 <= [[firstweekday]] <= 6
0 <= [[totaldays]] <= 33229
1 <= [[n]] <= 7
0 < length([[name]]) < 11
0 <= [[weekday]] <= 6 each day can be hated by at most <<one>> cat

write Number of days
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Week day of the start date of the period.
<<Line 2:>> Total amount of dates during the period.
<<Line 3:>> The [[n]] amount of brothers and sisters.
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> the [[name]] of one of Garfield's family members and the [[weekday]] they hate, separated by a space. The weekdays start at 0 representing Sunday and go until 6 representing Saturday.
data.outputDescription: A single line containing the number of <<opportunities>> they'll have to meet up. (How many days <<none>> of them hate)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Garfield's family is very peculiar. Each one of his cat brothers and sisters hates a particular day of the week. They don't want to do anything at all at that day, not even meet up with their family.

n brothers and sisters want to go to a picnic together, they decided to go between some start date and some end date. Your job is to find how many opportunities (How many days none of them hate) they'll have during that time period. You're given the weekday of start date and the total amount of days during that time period.
Input
Line 1: Week day of the start date of the period.
Line 2: Total amount of dates during the period.
Line 3: The n amount of brothers and sisters.
Next n lines: the name of one of Garfield's family members and the weekday they hate, separated by a space. The weekdays start at 0 representing Sunday and go until 6 representing Saturday.
Output
A single line containing the number of opportunities they'll have to meet up. (How many days none of them hate)
Constraints
0 <= firstweekday <= 6
0 <= totaldays <= 33229
1 <= n <= 7
0 < length(name) < 11
0 <= weekday <= 6 each day can be hated by at most one cat
Example
Input
0
365
1
Garfield 1
Output
313
